surface_layer.definition: The pathway through which electrical signals travel on a PCB, including conductive traces, components, and interconnects.

deep_layer.mechanism: Electrical signals move through the PCB along conductive traces and pass through components and interconnects to reach their destination.
deep_layer.origin: Determined by the layout and design of the PCB.

examples: Signal paths connecting a microcontroller to memory
Signal paths connecting a sensor to a processing unit

epistemic_metadata.source: How does the circuit board transmit signals ? – PCB HERO
